column5: Did a quick backcountryÂ camp with the family , great times and fishing .Â  	Started with utilizing a launch point a little sketchy with low water levels ,Â first time the lifted truck was useful lol. No pics as the stress levels were high on this particular launch . With the Boat loaded , two kids (10and 7)Â two dogs wife and myself we began the crawl to camp through the rock invested prop killing Â lake . Again no pics , to much going on . 	Landed at a site weâ€™ve visited for years and within an 30 min my son was walking the islands steep shoreline casting 3â€Â tubes for smallies and connecting !Â  	Once camp was set up I joined him casting Â a larger 4â€ smoke color tube hoping to get in on the action ..... picked up the odd one but kid destroyed me , downsizing was key. Fishing was great , Â we pounded all the rocky shoals and weed edges , classic ambush points . Seems smaller tubes in natural colors and reaction strikes withÂ jerk/twitch baits in a perch pattern were the ticket . Â Both The Smallies and walleye (evening bite) we wereÂ crushing them .Â  	I didnâ€™t have a chance to take fish pics , I apologize. No giants but steady 1-3 lb fish . Also found a beauty sandy beach area , onÂ a small island SCORE ! Cool note !!My kids were wading the rocky area of the island looking for minnows and crayfish and my son found what looks to be a legit carved Â arrow head, you can only imagine their imaginations running wild over at the camp fire that night over this discovery. Great trip , Â family loved it, everyone is gassed Including both dogs , and trust me ...itâ€™s anÂ extreme challenge to tire out a Belgian Malinois working dog lol.
Trips like this will last for ever in your dreams and memories. Thanks for show us a bit of it. Dan.

Keeping it for my grand daughter when she gets a little older. The dog looksÂ wasted for sure.
